review: We recently decided to dump cable and go with our digital antenna to get the networks (free) and use Netflix and Hulu Plus to get movies and other T.V. series, roughly $20 a month instead of the $90 we were paying for Dish.  So, we turned off Dish, but the problem was that the reception for Netflix and Hulu was terrible using our Samsung DVD player to connect.  It was constantly stopping and loading.  We live in a rural area so our internet is not the best and we don't have a lot of options.  We were going to give up and go back to Dish Satellite, when I decided to try the Chromecast that my son (who works for Google) had given us for Christmas.  The difference was incredible!  No more stalls, period.  We now open a program on our laptop in Hulu or Netflix and click the icon at the top of the screen and set the input on the TV and it plays perfectly.  Then, we can minimize the screen on the laptop and open a new browser and surf the internet while the program is playing.  I didn't think we needed this gift when we got it since we already had access to Netflix through the DVD player, but it turns out it's helping us save $840 a year!  Also another benefit is it's compact size.  It is plugged in behind the TV into one of the HDMI ports.  It is not visible from the front.  Nice job Google (and thanks for hiring my son, LOL).
